column4: i've seen different versions of an "8 in 1" CD of 8 versions of xp and windows in 1. is there a linux cd like this floating around?
DVD, perhaps, but not a CD
look for a Linux Format magazine at your local bookstore
bazhang i use ubuntu on a daily basis, and put together an old computer from spare parts. just wanted to see if there was a quick and easy way to mess w/ a few different versions
have you tried xubuntu on old hardware?
thats one of the ones on my list. i want to try KDE 4 first, since it is said to run on old hardware
run decently, i should add. =)
sounds like a good plan
the differences between the drivers are which cards they support
im using an nvidia 7800
then check the package details, and use the proper one
i have enabled them in the restricted driver manager. i just want to know if nvidia-glx-new is the most recent release for the driver, or if there are newer ones
okay, so by now you understand
yes. its using the restricted drivers from the package nvidia-glx-new, and didn't know if these are the newest, bleeding edge drivers
you have them. I told you...
didn't see it, sorry
we went through that.  The nvidia-glx-new package is for newer cards.  It's not a newer driver.
so that is not the newest build of the driver then?
you're confusing what the name is for.  It's to indicate that it supports the newer cards.  It has nothing to do with how new the drivers are.
ah, ok. gotcha there. ;) so how do i install the most recent driver for the card? i know with most drivers and other software for ubuntu, it is the most stable, not the newest
if you install something other than the ubuntu packages, keep in mind that we don't support that here.
it has been made easy
you don't need a card unless your current mobo doesnt' have an adequate IGP
